Name: Mummification scene
Description: This funerary monument is part of a characteristic group of stelae from Edfu and Dendera, dating from the end of the Ptolemaic Period. The stela depicts a scene of mummification. In the middle, one sees Anubis, standing next to an embalming bed in the form of a lion and holding an unguent vase in his left hand. On either side, Isis and Nepthys, their hands raised, are leaning towards the mummy. They are accompanied by the four Sons of Horus, protectors of the organs removed at the time of mummification. The text written in hieroglyphs contains the name and the titles of the deceased and the usual offering formulas.
